name: Opening of the Coal Exchange
obverse: A triangle of tree medallions in which are the heads of Prince Albert, the prince of Wales and the Princess Royal. In the center, a medallion of the head of Queen Victoria. Two scenes portraying the arrival of Prince Albert, the two children, and City dignitaries.
obverse_inscriptions: NEW COAL EXCHANGE OPENED OCT. 30TH 1849 BY H. R. H. PRINCE ALBERT ON BEHALF OF HER MAJESTY QUEEN VICTORIA
reverse: Interior of the exchange building within an ornamental border. Coat of arms of the City of London below.
reverse_inscriptions: THE RT HONBLE SIR JAMES DUKE LORD MAYOR - JOHN WOOD ESQRE CHAIRMAN OF THE COMMITTEE - JAMES B. BUNNING ESQRE ARCHITECT
description: This is #6 of the City of London medals. 350 specimens were struck.
Interestingly, the BHM reference has a typo for the reverse inscription, saying 'LORD MAJOR' instead of 'LORD MAYOR'.
